src:
Norsk l√∏pedronning ble hyllet 30 √•r etter bragden: ‚Äì Jeg var aldri s√¶rlig velkommen her
Ingrid Kristiansen f√∏lte seg be√¶ret da hun endelig ble innlemmet i det gode selskap. I mange √•r ble hun holdt utenfor.
05 Nov 2019, 07:13 by Mette Bugge
Ingrid Kristiansen er kommet i Hall of Fame, som New York Road Runners (NYRR) st√•r bak. Det skjedde i forbindelse med New York City Marathon sist helg, 30 √•r etter at hun vant l√∏pet etter √• ha kommet inn bakveien.
‚Äì Jeg hadde egentlig lurt p√• n√•r jeg skulle komme dit og f√• den p√•skj√∏nnelsen, men jeg har aldri v√¶rt s√¶rlig velkommen her i New York. Derfor ble jeg overrasket da det virkelig skjedde.
Hun innr√∏mmer at det er s√•rt √• tenke p√• at hun nesten aldri ble invitert til dette popul√¶re l√∏pet, som Grete Waitz vant ni ganger.
‚Äì Da jeg var p√• mitt aller beste, fikk jeg invitasjoner fra arrang√∏rer over hele verden, men ikke fra New York.

Har l√∏pt snaue fem maraton i helgen: ‚Äì Jeg har sovet 1,5 time

Vanskelig √• forst√• hvorfor
Hun trodde at arrang√∏rene var interessert i den aller beste, men det var med unntak av nettopp New York.
I Chicago derimot, og i Boston, var hun attraktiv for arrang√∏ren, og hun vant begge steder. Det samme gjorde hun flere ganger i London.
Kristiansen innr√∏mmer at det har v√¶rt s√•rt at hun ikke fikk delta s√• mange ganger som hun ville i New York.
‚Äì Jeg forst√•r ikke hvorfor, sier hun.

Smadret 16 √•r gammel verdensrekord p√• maraton

En imponerende liste
I de fleste √•rene p√• 1980-tallet var hun stor. Verdensrekorden p√• 2.21,06, som ble satt i London i 1985, sto i 13 √•r. Verdensrekorden p√• 10.000 meter, som ble satt i 1986, sto i 16 √•r.
I en periode hadde hun verdensrekordene b√•de p√• 5000 meter, 10.000 meter og maraton. Hun er den eneste i verden som har klart det.
Maraton var hun virkelig en ener i, og da hun likevel i 1989 fikk l√∏pe i verdensmetropolen i USA, √•ret etter at Grete Waitz vant der siste gang, endte det med seier til tr√∏nderen p√• tiden 2.25,30.
‚Äì Jeg hadde som m√•l at jeg det √•ret skulle vinne b√•de i Boston og New York, og det klarte jeg. Min sponsor, John Hancock, hjalp meg inn bakveien.
Den store sponsoren kunne sette et visst press p√• arrang√∏ren.
Kristiansen l√∏p mange maratonl√∏p i karrieren, og hennes bestetid p√• 2 timer og 21 minutter er fortsatt det beste en norsk kvinnelig l√∏per har levert p√• distansen 42 km og 195 meter.

Norsk rekordholder etter maratonbragd: ‚Äì Han er ikke den st√∏rste


Fakta: Ingrid Kristiansen
F√∏dt: 21. mars 1956
Sivilstand: Gift, tre barn
Klubber: Sportsklubben Freidig, IL Skjalg og BUL
Meritter: Ble verdensmester p√• 10.000 meter i 1987, og satte i l√∏pet av karrieren fem verdensrekorder p√• bane. EM-gull og bronse. 8 VM-medaljer, av dem fire gull. Kongepokal i 1985 og 1986. Fikk 24 titler i friidrett, og 8 i langrenn (stafett). Deltok i ski-VM i 1978 p√• 5 km og ble nummer 21.



Kristiansen er New York Marathons ¬´Hall of Fame¬ª.üì∑ Privat

Ble verdens beste
I starten av karrieren fikk Kristiansen innbydelser til l√∏pet der Waitz senere ble dronning. Det skjedde blant annet i 1978, da Waitz vant f√∏rste gang. Da kunne hun ikke BUL-l√∏peren dra p√• grunn av eksamen. √Öret etter hadde hun brukket foten og l√∏p bare over broen. I 1980 ble hun treer, toer √•ret etter nummer fem i 1982. F√∏lgende √•r ble hun mamma.
Det var fra 1984 frem til og med 1988 at det ikke kom noen invitasjoner. Kristiansen var en periode verdens beste maratonl√∏per.
‚Äì Hun hadde h√∏y status internasjonalt og ble k√•ret til verdens beste kvinnelige friidrettsut√∏ver to ganger, sier hennes dav√¶rende trener Johann Kaggestad.
Han forst√•r Kristiansen godt, men vil ikke spekulere i om uteblivelsen av invitasjon skyldes at Grete Waitz hadde slik h√∏y status nettopp i New York.
Ektemann Arve Kristiansen ble i sin tid s√• oppr√∏rt over behandlingen av kona at han skrev et brev til Norges Idrettsforbund, Norges Friidrettsforbund og Kulturdepartementet, der han mente at dette kunne beskrives som l√∏psfiksing ikke √• invitere henne. VG omtalte brevet i 2013.

Hun hadde aldri deltatt i organisert l√∏ping. L√∏rdag fullf√∏rte Lina (35) Oslo Maraton.


Fakta: Noen seire og h√∏ydepunkter
1984: London 2.24,26
1985: London 2.21,06
1986: Boston, 2.24,55
1986: Chicago 2.27,08
1987: London 2.22,48
1989: Boston 2.24,33
1989: New York City 2.25,30



Ingrid Kristiansen kan juble for seier i New York Marathon i 1988.üì∑ Adam Stoltman / AP

Ble minneverdig
Uansett er Ingrid Kristiansen forn√∏yd med at hun ikke er glemt. Hun forst√•r at sammenlignet med dagens stjerner, har hun g√•tt ut p√• dato.
‚Äì De er nye folk i ledelsen i NYRR og de har ikke med seg den gamle historien. Jeg ble overrasket da jeg ble invitert. Det var en √¶re √• komme hit og m√∏te de som n√• er i styre og stell i NY Road Runners.
Hun traff igjen en gammel konkurrent, Joan Benoit, og flere tidligere storl√∏pere.
‚Äì Det ble mye mimring.
PS: Disse fire l√∏perne ble √¶ret med Hall of Fame i 2019. Mar√≠lson Gomes dos Santos, Meb Keflezighi, Ingrid Kristiansen og Mary Wittenberg.

Oslo Maraton i bilder. Se blinkskuddene fra hovedstadens massem√∏nstring.
text:
Norwegian running queen was celebrated 30 years after the achievement: - I was never very welcome here
Ingrid Kristiansen felt honored when she was finally incorporated into the good company. For many years she was kept outside.
05 Nov 2019, 07:13 by Mette Bugge
Ingrid Kristiansen has joined the Hall of Fame, which is behind the New York Road Runners (NYRR). It happened in conjunction with the New York City Marathon last weekend, 30 years after she won the race after entering the back alley.
- I had really wondered when I would get there and get that appreciation, but I've never been very welcome here in New York. That's why I was surprised when it really happened.
She admits it's hard to think that she was almost never invited to this popular race, which Grete Waitz won nine times.
- When I was at my very best, I received invitations from organizers all over the world, but not from New York.

Has run a fast five marathons this weekend: - I've slept 1.5 hours

Hard to understand why
She thought the organizers were interested in the very best, but that was just New York.
In Chicago, however, and in Boston, she was attractive to the organizer, and she won both places. She did the same thing several times in London.
Kristiansen admits that it has been difficult for her to not attend as many times as she would in New York.
"I don't understand why," she says.

Smashed 16 year old world record at marathon

An impressive list
For most of the 1980s, she was great. The world record of 2.21.06, set in London in 1985, stood for 13 years. The world record 10,000 meters, set in 1986, stood for 16 years.
For a time she held the world records of 5000 meters, 10,000 meters and marathons. She is the only one in the world who has made it clear.
She was truly a marathon, and when in 1989 she was allowed to run in the world metropolis in the United States, the year after Grete Waitz won there last time, it ended with a victory for Tronder at 2.25,30.
- My goal was to win both Boston and New York that year, and I did. My sponsor, John Hancock, helped me in the back way.
The big sponsor could put some pressure on the organizer.
Kristiansen ran many marathons in her career, and her best time of 2 hours and 21 minutes is still the best a Norwegian female runner has delivered at a distance of 42 km and 195 meters.

Norwegian record holder after marathon performance: - He is not the greatest


Facts: Ingrid Kristiansen
Born: March 21, 1956
Marital status: Married, three children
Clubs: Sports Club Freidig, IL Skjalg and BUL
Merits: Became the 10,000m world champion in 1987, setting five world records during his career. European gold and bronze. 8 World Cup medals, four of them gold. King's trophy in 1985 and 1986. Received 24 titles in athletics, and 8 in cross-country (relay). Participated in the skiing championship in 1978 at 5 km and became number 21.



Kristiansen is the New York Marathon's "Hall of Fame." Private

Became the world's best
At the start of his career Kristiansen received invitations to the race where Waitz later became queen. That happened in 1978, when Waitz first won. Then she could not pull the BUL runner because of the exam. The following year she had broken her foot and just ran across the bridge. In 1980 she became threes, the year after number five in 1982. The following year she became a mother.
It was from 1984 up to and including 1988 that no invitations were received. Kristiansen was for a time the world's best marathon runner.
- She had a high status internationally and was named the world's best female athlete twice, says her former coach Johann Kaggestad.
He understands Kristiansen well, but will not speculate on the lack of invitation due to Grete Waitz having such a high status in New York.
Husband Arve Kristiansen was so upset over his wife's treatment that he wrote a letter to the Norwegian Sports Association, the Norwegian Athletics Association and the Ministry of Culture, where he felt that this could be described as race fixing not to invite her. VG mentioned the letter in 2013.

She had never participated in organized running. On Saturday, Lina (35) completed the Oslo Marathon.


Facts: Some victories and highlights
1984: London 2.24.26
1985: London 2.21.06
1986: Boston, 2.24.55
1986: Chicago 2.27.08
1987: London 2.22.48
1989: Boston 2.24.33
1989: New York City 2.25.30



Ingrid Kristiansen can cheer for victory in the New York Marathon in 1988.üì∑ Adam Stoltman / AP

Became memorable
In any case, Ingrid Kristiansen is satisfied that she is not forgotten. She understands that compared to today's stars, she has gone out of date.
- They are new people in the management of the NYRR and they do not have the old story with them. I was surprised when I was invited. It was an honor to come here and meet those now on the board of the NY Road Runners.
She again met an old competitor, Joan Benoit, and several former big runners.
- There was a lot of twilight.
PS: These four runners were honored with the Hall of Fame in 2019. Mar√≠lson Gomes dos Santos, Meb Keflezighi, Ingrid Kristiansen and Mary Wittenberg.

Oslo Marathon in pictures. Watch the flashes from the capital's mass muster.
